alert.note: Alert for Livingston (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 31 at 7:30PM CST until February 03 at 12:00PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Louisiana... Tickfaw River at Liverpool affecting St. Helena Parish. Tickfaw River Near Holden affecting Livingston Parish. For the Tickfaw River...including Liverpool, Holden...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING TO EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tickfaw River Near Holden. * WHEN...From Friday morning to early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Wooded areas in the vicinity of the Highway 190 bridge will be inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM CST Tuesday the stage was 11.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 15.0 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.1 feet on 04/12/1968. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued when updates are needed.
